clinical_study.brief_title: A Low Dose Remifentanil Infusion During Tracheal Extubation in Surgical Intensive Care Unit Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Low Dose Remifentanil Infusion During Tracheal Extubation in Surgical Intensive Care Unit Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Tracheal extubation can be associated with hyperdynamic circulatory response. The investigators examined the effect of maintaining a remifentanil infusion on the cardiovascular response during extubation in propofol-remifentanil sedated patients after surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Heart rate and mean arterial pressure at extubation and 5, 10 min from extubation Coughing grade at extubation (0 = no coughing, 1 = a single cough, 2 = more than one episode of non-sustained coughing, 3 = sustained and repetitive coughing with head lift)

secondary_outcome.description: Time of BIS > 80 : time between 'stopping of propofol' and Time of extubation : time between 'stopping of propofol' and 'extubation'

arm_group.description: stopping of propofol and remifentanil infusion
stopping of propofol and maintenance of remifentanil infusion

intervention.description: Control group : stopping of propofol and remifentanil infusion Remifentanil group : stopping of propofol and maintenance of remifentanil infusion
